entry.title: Suggestion: Link the linked accounts
entry.content:
(I tried to start this as a suggestion, but it seems I have no enough privileges, so I must bother you with a normal post)

So I had this account for years, since I fell in the SAP world circa 2004. It's linked to my personal e-mail account, and I want to keep it that way to preserve my sad and useless history of contributions here. Because it's a personal one, it's a P account. No problem with that.

But as I need to keep working with SAP, my company registered me another account linked to my company e-mail address. Because it's a professional one, and I assume my company pays for it somehow, it's an S account. Nice.

What's my problem? I join everyday here with my P account, I dig for info, and sometimes I find someone telling "check the XXXX note". So I go to me.sap.com to check that note and... I have no authorization there. I check my account info and I see both accounts linked, but the system is uncapable of decide that if I am in the support section, I must be treated as an S account, and treat me as a P account while in the community one.

So I must log out, log in again and keep doing that every day.

Please, try to change that behaviour to allow us with linked S&P accounts to be treated according to the section.

(it's curious how the post changed when I noticed "treat" comes without "h")

entry.title: API Execution Failed When Trying to Use ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù Feature in SAP Cloud Integration API on BTP Trial
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I recently ran into an issue while experimenting with SAP Cloud Integration on my SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) Trial Account, and I wanted to share my experience here in case anyone else has faced something similar‚Äîor if someone can point me in the right direction.

Scenario

As part of my learning journey in SAP Integration Suite, I created an Integration Flow (iFlow) in Cloud Integration (CPI) and successfully deployed it.

Then, I exposed the iFlow as an API through the API Management capability of BTP so that I could access it externally via a REST API call.

Everything went smoothly until I tried to test the API using the ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù feature from SAP API Business Hub.

Steps Followed

  1. Logged in to my SAP BTP Trial account.

  2. Opened Integration Suite ‚Üí Cloud Integration.

  3. Created and deployed an iFlow that returns some sample data.

  4. Exposed the iFlow as an API Proxy using API Management ‚Üí Design ‚Üí API Proxies.

  5. Opened the Cloud Integration API package on SAP API Business Hub.

  6. Clicked ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù to test one of the APIs (for example, /MessageProcessingLogs).

  7. Given the clientid and clientsecret from instance default_it-rt_integration-flow and also I tried with my BTP sign inuser id and password and it shows API execution failed. Please try again.

    Issue Facing

    When I clicked Execute, the system returned the following message:

    API execution failed. Please try again.

    No additional error details were displayed in the response window, and the API call did not reach my iFlow endpoint.

    Troubleshooting Attempted

    Here‚Äôs what I‚Äôve tried so far:

    • Verified that the iFlow is deployed and active.

    • Checked the runtime URL from the Monitor ‚Üí Manage Integration Content page.

    • Verified that my trial tenant is active and not in suspended state.

    • Checked API Business Hub ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù feature for other packages ‚Äî same issue occurs, which might indicate an environment limitation.

      My Understanding So Far

      It seems that the ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù feature on SAP API Business Hub might not support BTP Trial environments for certain APIs, especially those requiring authenticated connections to Cloud Integration runtime.

      In a productive BTP setup (non-trial), the ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù function usually works fine when proper credentials and destinations are configured.

      Request for Help

      Has anyone successfully used the Cloud Integration API ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù feature with a Trial account?
      If so, could you please share:

      • Any specific configuration or destination settings needed for trial accounts

      • Whether OAuth token-based authentication is mandatory

      • Or if this limitation is by design for BTP Trial users

        Conclusion

        I‚Äôm learning a lot about SAP Integration Suite and the API Management capabilities on BTP.
        Even though I‚Äôve hit this roadblock, it‚Äôs been a great opportunity to understand how authentication and API exposure work behind the scenes in the SAP ecosystem.

        Would love to hear from the community if anyone has faced and resolved this issue! üôå

entry.title: MRP Does not calculate the maximum values for ZB Type
entry.content:
Both Cost Center and Work Orders taken into consideration when MRP determines Reorder Qty (Planned Order Qty)

 

1012120 = Stores Stock is 8, Max/Min is 12/6. Reservation on Work Order for 3.

      MRP runs in the evening. Planned Order issued for Qty 4 (When the 3 are removed from stores it leaves 5, when the 4 are delivered we would have 9 in stores) Max is 12

      The reorder qty should have been 7 (not 6) so that qty in stores would be at Max of 12.

 

10123922 = Stores Stock is 30, Max/Min is 40/10. Reservation on Work Order for 80.

      MRP runs. Planned Order issued for Qty 60. (Upon receipt of the 60 ordered, the qty 80 will be goods issued from the storeroom leaving a qty of 10 in the storeroom.

The Reorder qty should have been Qty 90 (90 + 30 in stores = 120, once the 90 order are GR into stores, 90 + 30 in stores =120.) The reserved qty of 80 would be goods issued leaving 30   in stores unrestricted stock.

 

10321821 = Stores Stock is 4, Max/Min is 4/2. Reservation on Work Order for 6 & Cost Center Reservation for 3. Total of 9 Reserved. Planned Order issued for Qty of 7

      MRP runs. Planned Order issued for Qty 7. Upon receipt of the 7, the qty of 9 will be goods issued to the two reservations, leaving a qty of 2 in the storeroom.

The Reorder Qty (Planner Order Qty) Should have been 9

 

Can you help us what is missing.

Thanks in Advance.

Thiru

entry.title: How Difficult Is the SAP ERP Consultant Role Today?
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I wanted to start a discussion about the real level of difficulty in working as an SAP ERP consultant. The role keeps evolving, and I‚Äôm curious how others in the community see it today.

From my own experience in SAP FICO, the job definitely requires a mix of technical skills, business understanding, and continuous learning ‚Äî especially with S/4HANA, Fiori, and new cloud-related changes. It‚Äôs a demanding role, but also one that brings a lot of reward and growth.

I‚Äôd like to hear your thoughts:

  • What aspects of SAP consulting do you find the most challenging?
  • In your view, is the role becoming more difficult with newer SAP technologies, or are tools actually making things easier?
  • How do you keep up with the constant learning required?
  • What advice would you give to someone starting their SAP journey?

    Looking forward to hearing different perspectives from the community.

entry.title: Merge Potential & Performance Review with Multiple Calculated Ratings
entry.content:
Hello,

Costumer's requirement is to merge Potential with Performance Review.

In the form we have:

1.Objectives' section

2.Competencies' section (for Performance Review)

3.Competencies' section number 2 (for Potential Review)

The requirement is to have an Overall Performance Rating with a Calculated Rating that considers Objectives and Competencies for Performance Evaluation. And another summary section with a Calculated Rating that will consider Competencies for Performance Review and Competencies for Potential Review.

Is this achievable in the system? If yes, how can we achieve this? If no, can you suggest an alternative.

Thanks

entry.title: sap-btp-free-tier-access-issue
entry.content:
I‚Äôm reaching out to the SAP Community for help, as I‚Äôm currently blocked in my SAP BTP learning journey. I‚Äôm facing issues like the DCPP_017 error, difficulty enabling the Free Tier with my university email, and BAS access denied. If anyone has faced similar problems or knows a workaround, your support would mean a lot. Kindly take a moment to review the issue summary I‚Äôve included below. Thank you!

Issue Summary

Issue 1: BAS Access Denied in Trial Account

When navigating: SAP BTP Cockpit ‚Üí Services ‚Üí Instances and Subscriptions ‚Üí SAP Business Application Studio

I receive the following error:

Access Denied
You do not have the necessary roles to access SAP Business Application Studio.

 

Multiple SAP community posts suggest that Business Application studio access is restricted in Trial, and that switching to Free Tier resolves the problem.

What I Tried Next ‚Äî SAP Free Tier Setup

I followed SAP‚Äôs official page: Get an Account on SAP BTP to Try Out Free Tier Service Plans

But two new issues appeared:

Issue 2: Personal Email Not Allowed for Free Tier

When attempting to convert/join Free Tier:

To access SAP Free Tier, personal email domains are not allowed.
Please use a company or university email.

I used my University email (even though I already graduated).

Issue 3: Account Creation Failure (DCPP_017 Error)

After entering the required details using my university email, the process fails with:

 

I retried several times‚Äîsame error.

Support Ticket

I raised a support request through the SAP community. It has been 3 days with no response yet.

Request for Community Help

If anyone has:

1. Faced similar errors

2. Solved DCPP_017

3. Successfully enabled Free Tier using university email

4. Has insights into BAS access limitations

Your guidance will truly help me continue my SAP learning journey.

Thank you in advance!

- Vineeth

entry.title: Media Handling in RAP ABAP
entry.content:
In SAP RAP, ‚Äúmedia handling‚Äù basically means uploading and downloading files ‚Äî like images, PDFs, or documents ‚Äî through an OData service.
To make this possible, RAP needs three main things:

1. A Table to Store the File

You need a table in the ABAP system where the file will live.
This table usually has:

  • An ID

  • File name

  • Mime type (like image/png or application/pdf)

  • The file content (stored as RAW data)

Think of this table as a simple storage box for your documents.

2. A CDS View That Marks It as a ‚ÄúMedia Entity‚Äù

Next, you create a CDS view on top of the table.
Inside this view, you tell RAP which field contains the actual file content.

It‚Äôs like telling RAP:
‚ÄúHey, this field is the file itself.‚Äù

Once you do this, RAP automatically knows how to expose the file as $value in OData.

3. Behavior Definition (BDEF) to Enable Media Support

In the behavior definition, you simply add:

media;

This single keyword tells RAP:
‚ÄúAllow this entity to handle uploads and downloads.‚Äù
RAP will then generate the special URLs needed to work with files.

4. Small ABAP Code to Handle Upload & Download

You write very small methods that:

  • Read the file when someone wants to download it

  • Save the file when someone uploads it

These methods directly read or update the file field in the table.

Uploading a File

A file is uploaded by sending it to this URL:

PUT .../Entity(key)/$value

The binary content of the file is sent in the request body.

Downloading a File

To download the file:

GET .../Entity(key)/$value

In Simple Words

Media handling in RAP works like this:

  1. Make a place to store the file (DB table)

  2. Tell RAP which field contains the file (CDS view)

  3. Enable file support (behavior definition)

  4. Write tiny code to upload and download

  5. RAP automatically creates special URLs for file transfer

entry.title: Unable to Use ZCDS or Any Standard CDS View in AMDP Table Function
entry.content:
Dear All,

I am working in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud  and trying to consume a CDS View in an AMDP Table Function.

The object DDLS I_PRODUCTIONORDEROPCOMPONENTTP must not be used here, because it is not released for usage in AMDP methods.

entry.title: Why two different buttons for our own account?
entry.content:
On any website, it's customary to find a button in the top right to access your own account. There is such button on SAP Community website too. It has options: My Account, Settings, Subscriptions, Notification Center, Logout. Makes sense.

But where can we find our own content? Ah! For that, there is a tiny button below it. With options: My Content and... Sign Out.

I have so many questions, but mainly: what in tarnation is this and when can this be changed to a human-friendly UI?

entry.title: How can we avoid AI slop posts on SCN?
entry.content:
I don't want to see any AI "assisted" (= copy-pasted from ChatGPT) posts. I'm sure I'm not alone in this, people are getting fed up and justly so. Just one random example.

Adding "Gen AI assisted tag" is helpful but doesn't help to avoid the content. Ironically, tag is at the bottom, so you only see it after scrolling through the post.

Is there a way to mute or block the tag?

If not the tag, is it possible to mute or block specific accounts?
